entry.def: You can refer to someone as a payer if they pay a particular kind of bill or fee. For example, a mortgage payer is someone who pays a mortgage.

example.ex: Lower interest rates pleased millions of mortgage payers.
example.tran: 利率下调让数百万抵押贷款还款人感到高兴。

entry.def: A good payer pays you quickly or pays you a lot of money. A bad payer takes a long time to pay you, or does not pay you very much.

example.ex: I have always been a good payer and have never gone into debt...
example.tran: 我一直及时付款，从未欠债。

example.ex: The firm was owed around £300,000 by late payers.
example.tran: 该事务所被拖欠了约30万英镑。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who pays money for something

sentences.en: When the new tax laws were passed,the tax payers found that the government had clapped another 5% on cigarettes.
sentences.cn: 新税法通过后,纳税人发现政府在香烟上又增加了5%的税。
